Name.label: Genetic susceptibility to infections due to particular pathogens

TextSection.Contents: Mendelian susceptibility to mycobacterial diseases (MSMD) is a rare immunodeficiency syndrome, characterized by a narrow vulnerability to poorly virulent mycobacteria, such as bacillus Calmette-GuÃ©rin (BCG) vaccines and environmental mycobacteria (EM), and defined by severe, recurrent infections, either disseminated or localized.

Synonym.label: Idiopathic infection caused by BCG or atypical mycobacteria
